hospitalities.title: Introduction
hospitalities.desc:
Hello Patrons!

The Hospitality Team of Kurukshetra 2016 welcomes you aboard the 10th edition of The Battle of Brains.

Are you looking out to set camp so as to prepare yourself to get engaged in the Battle with full throttle? Yes, We have made arrangments and set an environment that would give you "AT HOME" experience. Also, to make sure that you are on the right and the most feasible path, we've got everything in-house right from events schedule and transportation queries to a variety of appetizing food stalls.

Once you have reached Chennai, it is our responsibility to keep your experience hassle free, ensure safe transportation and provide a comfortable stay during Kurukshetra. We promise to keep you mentally boosted and focussed during your stay for Kurukshetra and to make sure you return back home with a lot of splendid memories.

Anytime, we would be delighed to assist you and answer all your queries regarding Kurukshetra 2016.

hospitalities.title: Reaching CEG
hospitalities.desc:
We know you will be nervous about finding your way around in a new city. Now you don't have to worry as we have listed out all the possible ways to get to CEG for Kurukshetra 2016! 

From Chennai Central

By Bus

» Board 15B, 15G, 15F at the Central bus stop and transfer at Broadway Bus Stand. Board 21G (or) 21L from Broadway to Anna University. The buses are very frequent in this route and this is the most recommended mode of reaching the University from Central.

» Board 19G opposite to the railway station and ask for Anna University/Gandhi Mandapam. This bus is not frequent.

» Board PP21 (during 4 am to 7 am) at the bus stop just outside the railway station and ask for Anna University/Gandhi Mandapam. This bus is not frequent as well.

By Train

There is no stop at Anna University by train. You do have other options, by transferring at a station.

Option 1:

» Trains to Guindy station depart from the Park Railway Station opposite to the Chennai Central Railway Station.

» Exit the Guindy railway station (by taking a right in the crossover meant for pedestrians) and cross the road using the subway. From here you have a number of options.

     » As soon as you exit the subway, you will find a lane towards your right wherein you can find the bus stop. You can board M21G, 21G, PP21, M19, M49, 54F, 577,  549 and get down at Anna University.

     » You can also opt to take share autos to Anna University, available near the subway which would cost Rs. 15 per person.

Option 2:

» You can also board the MRTS (Flying train) from the Park Town which is adjacent to the government hospital and alight at Kasturibai Nagar Railway Station Here you can get a share auto or a bus next to the Madhya Kailash Temple, outside the Kasturibai Nagar station, to Anna University.

NOTE: PARK is different from PARK TOWN)

By Auto/Taxi

» You can also avail the facility of prepaid auto service .The fare will be around Rs.150.

» State the destination as “Anna University, Kotturpuram Gate”.

From Egmore Railway Station

By Bus

In Egmore, near Pantheon Road and Haals Road junction, you can board 23C. This is a frequently available bus. Travel time might be 45-50 minutes.

By Train

» Electric trains will also be available to the Guindy station.

» Exit the Guindy railway station (by taking a right in the crossover meant for pedestrians) and cross the road using the subway. From here you have a number of options.

     » As soon as you exit the subway, you will find a lane towards your right wherein you can find the bus stop. You can board M21G, 21G, PP21, M19, M49, 54F, 577, 549 and get down at Anna University.

     » You can also opt to take share autos to Anna University, available near the subway which would cost Rs. 15 per person.

By Auto/Taxi

» The auto fare will be approximately Rs 100. Fix the rate before boarding.

» There are no prepaid auto services at Egmore station.

From Koyambedu/CMBT

By Bus:

CMBT is Chennai Mofussil Bus Terminus. Plenty of buses take routes through Anna University or with a transfer very close-by (T. Nagar or Guindy).

» Board 23M, PP49, T70, 149 which have a stop at Anna University. These buses are not frequent.

» Board 27C or M27 to T.Nagar and transfer to 5B, 19C, 19B, 47, 47A, 47D to reach Anna University.

» Board M70, M70D, B70, C70, D70, M170C, 170C to Guindy. From the Guindy bus-stop, 

     » Board the M21G, 21G, PP21, M19, M49, 54F, 577, 549 to Anna University.

     » You can also opt to take share autos to Anna University, available near the subway which would cost Rs. 15 per person. 

The route through Guindy is the most recommended one since these buses are very frequent.

By Metro Rail:

» You can experience Chennai Metro Rail service from Koyembedu to Alandur (Kathipara junction). Options of reaching Anna University from Alandur (Kathipara junction) are given below (under the travel option from Perungalathur).

From Perungalathur

For those arriving from southern districts of Tamil Nadu, since the buses take the Bypass road to CMBT after 6 am, you cannot get down at the Kathipara junction. Rather you can get down at Perungalathur.

» From here you can board 577 or PP21 to Anna University. These buses are not frequent.

» You may also take a train to Guindy from the Perungalathur junction just behind the bus stop. Exit the Guindy railway station (by taking a right in the crossover meant for pedestrians) and cross the road using the subway. From here you have a number of options.

     » As soon as you exit the subway, you will find a lane towards your right wherein you can find the bus stop. You can board M21G, 21G, PP21, M19, M49, 54F, 577, 549 and get down at Anna University.

     » You can also opt to take share autos to Anna University, available near the subway which would cost Rs. 15 per person.

From Kathipara Junction

For those arriving from the southern districts of Tamil Nadu, if your bus did not take the bypass road before Tambaram, you can get down at Kathipara Junction.

» Board 21G, PP21 to Anna University. This is the recommended way.

» Board any bus to Guindy (next stop). From here,

     » Board M21G, 21G, PP21, M19, M49, 54F, 577,  549 to Anna University. 

     » You can also opt to take share autos to Anna University, available near the subway which would cost Rs. 15 per person.

hospitalities.title: FAQs
hospitalities.desc:
» How to apply for my accommodation during Kurukshetra 2016?

Initially you need to fill the accommodation application form, which will be available in our website once the registration starts. We will contact you soon after this and you will be asked to provide some details. By confirming with us those details you will become eligible for accommodation. 

» What should I do after registering for accommodation?

An automatic mail will be sent to the e-mail ID provided and details about the documents that are required to become eligible for accommodation will be explained clearly in the mail.

» What are the documents I need to ensure my eligibility for my accommodation?

The scanned copy of the train or bus ticket/ERS of your travel or Bonafide certificate with the format specified during Accommodation registration.

» What should I do after sending proof for need of accommodation?

Please be patient. Processing all the documents requires some time and confirmation/waiting list mail will be sent after that.

» Does my eligibility alone confirm my accommodation?

No. Though eligibility is a very important criterion for allocation of rooms, it cannot be taken as the confirmation of your accommodation. After receiving all your details, allocation process will be done for eligible applicants and you will be intimated through e-mail if your accommodation is confirmed.

» When will I get my accommodation confirmation mail?

After receiving all accommodation proofs and processing them, mails will be sent to both confirmed and wait-listed people.

» What should I do with my confirmation mail (for accommodation)?
You need to bring the printed copy of the confirmation mail along with all other details and documents mentioned.

» I have a friend staying in the college hostel. Can I stay with him/ her?

No. Staying with acquaintances is strictly prohibited and if found, disciplinary action will be taken against the student of CEG by the college authorities. In addition, the participant will be asked to vacate immediately and alternate accommodation will not be provided. The concerned participant will also be prohibited from participating in any event/workshop/lecture.

» Where do I stay and what is the procedure?
You must stay only in the allotted room in the appropriate block. Boys and girls will be accommodated separately in an arrangement like that of a dormitory. On producing your k! ID and accommodation receipt, the volunteer in the respective block will guide you to your room. The procedure will be given in detail in the Hospitality homepage.

» Are there ATMs inside the campus?

There are State Bank of India (SBI), Canara Bank and Indian bank ATMs available in the campus near the main Canteen. A Karur Vysya Bank ATM is also available, but is inside the Department of Information and Science Technology.

» What are the documents that I should bring to avail accommodation during Kurukshetra 2016?

You must bring the following documents:

» Printed copy of the completed accommodation form (which will be mailed to you once you have completed accommodation procedure)

» Original College ID card (or) Bonafide Certificate.

» Two recent passport size photographs.

Failure to produce any of the above documents may result in cancellation of your accommodation.

» What is the first thing I should do on entering the campus?
All participants should register and collect their k! ID from the registration desk. Participants who are not from Chennai and have confirmed accommodation should report at the registration desk, where required formalities, including checking of documents, allotment of rooms, etc will be completed.

» Where can I eat?

Canteens and food stalls will be open throughout the day, offering a variety of food. The participants can have their food at their own expense at the canteens and/or food stalls.

» What about the security of my belongings?

Participants are responsible for the security of their belongings during their stay. Neither the Kurukshetra 2016 team nor the institute will take responsibility for any loss. Participants are advised to bring their own locks.

» Where should I go in case of health related emegerencies, if any?

A health centre is available inside the campus. You can make use of it in case of any medical problem. In case of any illness, you or your team members can contact the volunteers and we shall ensure immediate attention.

» How do I check-out?
The participants are required to return all the utilities (provided at the time of check-in) and submit a NO-DUES clearance from the respective block in-charges in order to receive their Refundable deposit.

» Once accommodated, can I go out of the university before I vacate?
We don't encourage your outings during the event days. Even if you wish to go, you should return to your respective rooms before 8.30 PM( for girls) and before 9.30 PM (for boys), beyond which hostels will be closed. Defaulters will have to face the hostel's procedure of fine.

» I still have some questions unanswered. Whom do I approach for answers?
Mail your queries to hospidesk@kurukshetra.org.in . We will get in touch and clarify your queries as soon as possible.
